questions.text: The years of potential life lost could be attributed to?

options.label: B
options.text: Years lost due to premature death.

options.label: D
options.text: Years lost to poor quality of life.

questions.correct_answer: B. Years lost due to premature death.
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • • DALY is disability adjusted life years.
  • • • DALY refers to YLL + YLD (Years of life lost due to premature death/ potential life lost + Years of life lost due to disability).

questions.text: Global Hunger Index which of the following is not a part of it?
2 doctors were asked to report 100 X- rays and Kappa value 0.71; what is interpretation?
Longitudinal Observational/ follow up and Analytical Study is:

30,000 people were followed for period of 30 years. At the end of the 30 years; 1200 people were found to be diseases. From those who were non diseased; equal number of controls were assigned at end. Type of study design is:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Advanced Cohort Study: Case Control Studies Based in A defined Cohort
  • • • Predominantly a type of cohort study (due to a forward direction)
  • • • Advantages:
  • • • Problem of recall bias is eliminated
  • • • Advantage of temporality is maintained
  • • • Economical (Done for rare diseases + whose diagnostic tests are very expensive)
  • • • Greater comparability (as both cases & controls are derived from the original cohort)
  • • • Disadvantage: non diseased persons from whom the controls are selected may not be fully representative of original cohort, due to death or failure to follow up cases
  • • • Types of Advanced Cohorts:

questions.text: Which of the following is not correctly matched?

Research is being conducted to find the association between aniline dye exposure and bladder cancer in workers of an industry who have worked for > 20 years. 2 groups were formed; one directly involved in dye handling and other group consisted of office clerks not directly exposed to the dye. Years of occupation was noted from previous records. What type of study is being performed?
Case control study which among the following is not true:
Male mortality rate is type of:
Match IP (in days) of the diseases:
A 10-year-old child presents with rash and Koplik spots. The most probable diagnosis is:
Full term delivery with baby having signs of prematurity, LBW, cataract and PDA. The most probable cause will be:
A boy’s hostel has an outbreak of fever cases with headache followed by the development of pleomorphic rashes sparing palms and soles. What is the next best step in management in suspected cases?

options.label: A
options.text: Isolate for 6 days after giving acyclovir followed by VZIg within 72 hours of exposure.

options.label: B
options.text: Isolate for 12 days after giving acyclovir followed by VZIg within 48 hours of exposure.

options.label: D
options.text: Only give VZIg to all contacts

questions.correct_answer: C. Only isolate cases for 6 days
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • VZIg:
  • • • Within 72 hours (OPTION B is excluded)
  • • • Given to all susceptible individuals for people who are immunocompromised (NOT GIVEN IN ALL) (OPTION A & D is excluded)
  • • Role of Acyclovir:
  • • • Mainly given in adults (not given in children) (OPTION A is excluded)
  • • Role of OKA vaccine:
  • • • Given to children
  • • • Given to all
  • • • Within 5 days of exposure

questions.text: A patient visits a TB clinic; according to NTEP what is the next step for a patient with sputum negative; but chest X ray showing signs of TB?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Now we don’t go for repeat SS.

questions.text: A young male has a clean wound without any bleeding. The patient received full course of tetanus vaccination 10 years ago. What is the best management of the patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Immunoglobulin and full course of vaccine

questions.correct_answer: A. Single dose of Tetanus vaccine

questions.text: A 10-year-old child (class 5) should be given which of the following vaccines?
Which of the following vaccines can be given in pregnancy? 1. COVID vaccine 2. Measles, Mumps, Rubella vaccine 3. Hepatitis B vaccine 4. Rabies vaccine
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • All LA vaccines are C/I in pregnancy except rabies (in case of bite); Yellow fever, cholera and OPV (Outbreak and travel) and COVID vaccines.

questions.text: Consider the following vaccines: 1. BCG Vaccine 2. Hepatitis B Vaccine 3. Inactivated Polio Vaccine (IPV) 4. Oral Polio Vaccine (OPV) What is the correct order of the above vaccines as per their sensitivity to heat (most sensitive to least sensitive) given in the National Immunization Schedule (NIS)?

Which among the following vaccines best represent interventions that focus on cancer prevention too? 1. Hepatitis A vaccine 2. Hepatitis B vaccine 3. Hemophilus influenzae B vaccine 4. Human papilloma virus vaccine
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Hep B: Hepatocellular cancer
  • • HPV: Cervical cancer

questions.text: What is the correct increasing order of minimum age at which the following vaccine, are administered to a child, as part of the National Immunization Schedule (NIS) after birth of child? 1. BCG vaccine 2. Japanese Encephalitis (JE) vaccine 3. Rotavirus vaccine 4. Tetanus and adult diphtheria (Td) vaccine

Which among the following is correct about yellow fever vaccination requirement for international travelers? 1. Term of validity of the certificate is changed from 10 years to the duration of the life of the vaccinated person, some years ago. 2. Lifetime validity of the certificate applies automatically to all existing and new certificates. 3. Validity of the certificate begins 4 days after vaccination. 4. In India, booster dose of yellow fever vaccine is required for those whose certificate is prior to the year 2016.
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • International certificate of vaccination
  • • • All including infants (including those in transit)
  • • • If no certificate: Vaccine given & kept for 6 days (IP = 3- 6 days) from in a mosquito proof ward.
  • • • If traveller arrives before certificate becomes valid (10 days after vaccination): kept in mosquito free ward till it becomes valid.

questions.text: Regarding active immunization against Typhoid fever, consider the following statements: 1. The typhoid polysaccharide vaccine is injectable and can be given subcutaneously or intramuscularly. 2. The typhoid polysaccharide vaccine is required to be given in two doses and administered on 0 and 7th day. 3. The typhoid oral Ty2la vaccine requires to be given in three doses on 0, 3rd and 7th days. 4. Protective immunity with typhoid vaccines is achieved immediately after the vaccine is received.
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Statement 1: Polysaccharide vaccine has single human dose.
  • • Statement 3: Typhoral (Live oral Ty21a)
  • • – Contains > 109 viable organisms of attenuated S Typhi
  • • – Principle of 3 – 3 doses – on day 1, 3, and 5, once every 3 years, protection for 3 years
  • • Statement 4: Immunity doesn’t develop immediately and that is why it is not given post disaster to victims.

questions.text: The event related to vaccination which can be contraindication for the next vaccination of similar/ identical type is

options.label: C
options.text: Abscess at injection site after DPT vaccine

questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Encephalopathy following DPT is an absolute C/I for further doses.

questions.text: Which of the following events could be caused or precipitated by an active component of vaccine? 1. Anaphylaxis after measles vaccine 2. Encephalopathy after DPT vaccine 3. Adenitis following BCG vaccine. 4. Gastroenteritis following MMR vaccine.
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • • Anaphylaxis although rare can be caused by measles vaccine.
  • • • Encephalopathy due to pertussis
  • • • Lymphadenitis is also rare but associated with BCG.
  • • • Gastroenteritis is not associated with measles, mumps, or rubella.

questions.text: Vaccine-associated poliomyelitis (VAPP) chiefly seen with which of the following strains of oral poliovirus?
In which one of the following diseases are the source of infection and reservoir of infection the same?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Reservoir and source of infection may or may not be similar, similar in majority (In tetanus they are similar (soil)
  • • • Hookworm:
  • • – Reservoir: Man
  • • – Source: Soil
  • • • S typhi:
  • • – Reservoir: GB of infected individual
  • • – Source: Food contaminated by carrier

questions.text: In which one of the following vector-borne diseases, the transmission chain is 'Man-Snail-Man'?
Which one among the following is best defined as the interval of time between receipt of infection by a host and maximal infectivity of that host?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • • Serial interval:
  • • – the gap in time between onset of primary & secondary cases
  • • • Infectious (communicable) period:
  • • – length of time a person can transmit disease.
  • • • Incubation period: E --------- → Development of disease.
  • • • Latent period: E--------- → Onset of infectiousness
  • • – may be shorter or longer than the incubation period.
  • • • Generation time: E ----------- → Maximal infectivity of the host
  • • • Window Period: E----- → Lab detection of disease

questions.text: BP of people was tracked from childhood to adulthood. It was observed that those who had lower BP in childhood had low BP in adulthood, while those who had higher in childhood had high BP in adulthood. This can be best described as:
What significant error did the intern make while creating a banner on measures to prevent the spread of NCDs, as assigned by a group of doctors?
questions.correct_answer: C. Shift from PUFA to TRANSFAT

questions.text: Screening for Cervical Cancer at SC and PHC level:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Cervical Cancer Prevention
  • • • Primary Prevention
  • • • Secondary Prevention: Using VIA (Visual Inspection with Acetic Acid) or HPV testing to screen women for cervical cancer prevention above 29 years of age
  • • – Once a woman is screened to be HPV negative, she should not undergo re- screening in between 3 to 5 years

questions.text: Rukmini is attending Village Nutrition and Sanitation Day. How frequently it is conducted?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • The VHND is to be organized once every month (preferably on Wednesdays, and for those villages that have been left out, on any other day of the same month) at the AWC in the village.

questions.text: 1st trimester pregnancy + Falciparum malaria DOC is:

options.label: C
options.text: 100 mg iron once a day + 500 ug FA

questions.correct_answer: A. 60 mg Elemental Iron + 500 ug FA

questions.text: NSSK is for:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Navjat Shishu Suraksha Karyakram (NSSK)
  • • Training of ANM/ SN/ Dr. in providing basic & resuscitative new born care & urgent referral for hospital admission

questions.text: Which is not included under JSY?
questions.explanation:

  • • • Celebrate Village Health and Nutrition Day

questions.text: Which of the following is related to JSSK?

Explanation:

questions.text: Which of the following are beneficiaries of services provided under the Integrated Child Development Scheme (ICDS)? 1. Adolescent boys 2. Adolescent girls 3. Pregnant women 4. Children less than 6 years of age
The cost of implementation of `Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana' is borne by:

options.label: C
options.text: Both Central Government and State Government

options.label: D
options.text: Private institutions only as a part of their Corporate Social Responsibility

questions.correct_answer: C. Both Central Government and State Government
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • PM-JAY is fully funded by the Government and the cost of implementation is shared between the Central and State Governments.

questions.text: All the following are dashboard indicators used for monitoring of India Newborn Action Plan (INAP). Which one of them is an 'impact level indicator'?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • This question would be solved by common sense of options as it is not possible to remember indicators for all programs. Ref: Page 61 and 62; INAP Program Document

questions.text: The expected outcome of Government of India's initiative `SUMAN' is:

options.label: A
options.text: Zero preventable maternal and newborn deaths

options.label: B
options.text: Limit preventable maternal and newborn deaths to between 0.5 - 1%

options.label: C
options.text: Limit preventable maternal and newborn deaths to between 1 - 2%

options.label: D
options.text: Limit preventable maternal and newborn deaths to between 2 - 5%

questions.correct_answer: A. Zero preventable maternal and newborn deaths
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • SUMAN program is for addressing the existing inequities in maternal and newborn health care services and move towards zero preventable maternal and newborn deaths.

questions.text: Under the National Leprosy Eradication Program, ASHAs have been entrusted to carry out which of the following activities? 1. ASHAs are to search for suspected cases of leprosy in their villages and take them to the PHCs for diagnosis and treatment. 2. ASHAs arrange an amount of 5,000 as an incentive to each leprosy affected person in their village for undergoing reconstructive surgery. 3. ASHAs ensure that each leprosy affected person in their village receives micro-cellular rubber footwear for protection of insensitive feet. 4. ASHAs follow up all confirmed cases of leprosy in their village to ensure their treatment is completed.
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • All the 4 activities are conducted by ASHA workers, but she receives incentives only for activity 1 & 4.

questions.text: NACO (National AIDS Control Organization) in India works towards which of the following causes? 1. Screening high risk cases of HIV 2. Facilitating adoption of orphans 3. Public education towards safe sex 4. Treating HIV cases free of cost

In the National Health Policy 2017, a target of 90: 90: 90 has been set for HIV/AIDS. Which among the following are targets for which a 90% level has been set as part of 90: 90: 90 for HIV/AIDS? 1. Proportion of couples who have safe sex 2. Proportion of people living with HIV who know their HIV status 3. Proportion of adolescents who have access to contraceptives 4. Proportion of people receiving antiretroviral therapy who have viral suppression
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • National Strategic Plan (NSP) for HIV/ AIDS & STI, 2017- 24
  • • • Vision: Paving the way for an AIDS free India
  • • • Goal: 0 new infections; 0 AIDS related deaths; 0 discrimination
  • • • Targets by 2020:
  • • – 75% reduction in new HIV infections
  • • – 90- 90- 90: 90% of those who are HIV positive in country know their status; 90% who know their status are on treatment & 90% those who are on treatment are on effective viral load suppression
  • • – Elimination of parent to child transmission of HIV & syphilis
  • • – Elimination of stigma & discrimination

questions.text: The Sample Registration System (SRS), an important source of health information, consists of continuous enumeration of births and deaths by an enumerator and an independent survey every six months by an investigator-supervisor. Which one of the following terms best describes this system?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Sample Registration System
  • • Dual record system:
  • • • Field investigation: continuous enumeration of births & deaths by enumerator
  • • • Independent retrospective survey: every 6 months by a supervisor
  • • • Advantages:
  • • – Elimination of errors of duplication
  • • – Self-evaluating technique

Folate supplements, from confirmation of pregnancy to the end of first trimester C. Zinc supplements, from one month before conception to three months after D. Zinc supplements, from confirmation of pregnancy to the end of first trimester

Consider the following statements: Statement-I: While calculating the number of expected pregnancies per year in an area, a correction factor (usually 10%) is added to the expected number of live births in the year in the area. Statement-II: All the pregnancies in the area may not be registered by the health worker in the area. Which one of the following is correct in respect of the above statements?

options.label: A
options.text: Statement-I and Statement-II are independently correct, and Statement-II is a correct explanation for Statement-I.

options.label: B
options.text: Statement-I and Statement-II are independently correct, but Statement-II is not a correct explanation for Statement-I.

options.label: C
options.text: Statement-I is correct, but Statement-II is incorrect.

options.label: D
options.text: Statement-I is incorrect, but Statement-II is correct.

questions.correct_answer: B. Statement-I and Statement-II are independently correct, but Statement-II is not a correct explanation for Statement-I.

questions.text: Calculate MMR in population; 2 died due to ectopic; 2 by abortion; 2 by electrocution; 2 by sepsis; 4 by PPH; 4000 live births; 5 still births.
Maternal Mortality doesn’t include?

options.label: B
options.text: Death of pregnant woman due to accident

questions.correct_answer: B. Death of pregnant woman due to accident

Explanation:

  • • Maternal Mortality is defined as
  • • • Pregnant & post-delivery till 42 days
  • • • Death due to pregnancy related cause (Not due to accident)
  • • • Irrespective of period of gestation

questions.text: ANMOL app is related to:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • ANMOL: ANM Online
  • • Tablet based version of MCH app.

questions.text: The best indicator of status in terms of availability and utilization of health care of a country is:

Explanation:

  • • Importance of IMR: Most important indicator of:

  • • • Health status of a community/ country
  • • • Level of living
  • • • Effectiveness of MCH services/ Best predictor of govt. Failure
  • • • Combined parameter for paediatric & obstetric care in country
  • • Sensitive indicator of availability & utilization of health services

questions.text: A 30-week primigravida presents with complaints of reduced vision of night. She has been avoiding papaya, mango, and other fruits throughout the pregnancy as she thinks they could be abortifacients. It is the duty of which of the following worker to provide counselling and information to the patient to address these myths at home?
A female comes for her first ANC at 8 weeks of gestation and is found to have a Hb of 9 gm%. The IFA tablets will be started:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • If the female is anaemic then we need to give IFA irrespective of the period of gestation.

questions.text: Which of the following correctly represents the three critical determinants of a healthy facility being declared as a First Referral Unit (FRU)? 1. Availability of emergency obstetric surgical interventions 2. Availability of immunization services 3. Blood storage facility 4. Newborn care
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • First Referral Unit (FRU)
  • • 3 critical determinants:
  • • • Availability of surgical interventions (LSCS & hysterectomy mainly)
  • • • Newborn care
  • • • Blood storage facility on 24-hour basis

questions.text: The daily average dietary nutrient intake level sufficient to meet the nutrient requirement of nearly all (97- 98%) healthy individuals in a particular life stage and gender group is knows as:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA):
  • • • 97.5% population
  • • • RDA is not used for energy (excess energy intake will lead to obesity) Estimated Average Requirement (EAR): 50% amount of a nutrient estimated to be adequate for half of the healthy individuals of a specific age and sex

questions.text: Diarrhoea, Dementia, Dermatitis is seen in deficiency of:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Pellagra – 4 D’s: Diarrhoea; Dermatitis; Dementia; Death

questions.text: Which of the following is most common cause for night blindness?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Vitamin A is leads to night blindness

questions.text: In a village, several farmers have crossed gait in lower limbs and use a stick for walking support. Due to poor yield from farms, they consume means with only rice and pulses. Which vitamin supplementation can prevent the clinical findings?

A patient visits the PHC with progressive spastic paraparesis and lower limb weakness. The village has had successive crop failures and are facing financial challenges. Which of the following toxin maybe implicated with this condition?
Xeropthalmia is considered a public health problem if the prevalence of bitot’s spot is more than?
questions.explanation:

  • • 6 months to 6 years:
  • • • Night blindness: 1%
  • • • Bitot’s Spot: 0.5%

questions.text: Iron absorption is decreased in which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Tea has tannates which hinders the absorption of iron.
  • • Iron absorption is facilitated by Vitamin C (amla and lemon)

questions.text: Mother of a breast-feeding child only eats vegetables. Which deficiency is common?

  • • Only vegetable diet has deficiency of Vitamin B 12

questions.text: Which food proteins among the following are the best and are used in nutritional studies as 'reference protein'?

Explanation:

questions.text: Consider the following disorders: 1. Delayed motor milestones 2. Extrapyramidal spasticity 3. Nyctalopia 4. Hearing defects Which of the above disorders occur as part of the spectrum of Iodine deficiency disorders?
The 'Nalgonda Technique' developed by the National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (NEERI) was developed primarily for the removal of which one of the following from water?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • NALGONDA technique is a method of defluorination where 1st lime is added and then alum.

questions.text: Which of the following are domains (or types) of learning? 1. Affective learning 2. Cognitive learning 3. Physiological learning 4. Psychomotor learning
Family cycle sequence, identify the correct sequence?

options.label: A
options.text: Formation; Extension; Complete extension; Contraction; Complete Contraction; Dissolution; Extinction

options.label: B
options.text: Dissolution; Extinction; Formation; Extension; Complete extension; Contraction; Complete Contraction

options.label: C
options.text: Complete extension; Formation; Extension; Contraction; Complete Contraction; Dissolution; Extinction

options.label: D
options.text: Formation; Extension; Dissolution; Complete extension; Contraction; Complete Contraction; Extinction

questions.correct_answer: A. Formation; Extension; Complete extension; Contraction; Complete Contraction; Dissolution; Extinction

questions.text: During a disease outbreak, the health worker will collect the water sample for bacteriological investigation as:

options.label: A
options.text: Container is kept close to the tap to avoid spillage.

options.label: B
options.text: Turn on the water for one minute, then water is collected.

options.label: C
options.text: Collect water from already leaking pipes.

options.label: D
options.text: Collect from a gentle stream of water to avoid splashing.

questions.correct_answer: D. Collect from a gentle stream of water to avoid splashing.

questions.text: What type of sanitation facilities should be provided for the refugees/ soldiers returning from War?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Trench Latrine is only recommended for the immediate emergency response.
  • • An aqua privy is a tank filled with water into which excreta falls via a drop pipe. It uses a water seal to prevent odours getting out of the tank and a soak-away pit to dispose of sullage and effluent. The drop pipe in the tank extends below the surface of the water to prevent the escape of odours.
  • • Pit latrines collect human faeces in a hole in the ground. The principle of a pit latrine is that all liquids that enter the pit – in particular urine and water used for anal cleansing – seep into the ground.

questions.text: Which of the following statements are correct regarding Chikungunya fever? 1. It is usually transmitted by Culex mosquito. 2. A safe and effective vaccine is available for commercial use. 3. Incubation period is 4 - 7 days. 4. One of the prominent symptoms is arthropathy.
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Option1: Aedes
  • • Option 2: No vaccine is available.

questions.text: Air humidity and dew point temperature of the air is measured using which of the following instrument?
Biological method for controlling mosquito larvae:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Biological control is done by larvicidal fishes.

questions.text: Rickettsial mite causes:
Reservoir of Leishmaniasis in India?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Humans are the only reservoir host in this region for the parasite causing the disease. The only way the disease spreads from human to human is by one insect in the region, Phlebotomus argentipes.

questions.text: Which of the following mosquito-borne diseases are transmitted chiefly by Aedes mosquito? 1. Dengue 2. West Nile fever 3. Yellow fever 4. Zika fever

With reference to occupational cancers, consider the following statements: 1. Skin cancer is a common occupational hazard in workers employed in nickel and chromium work. 2. Cancer bladder is an occupational hazard in workers employed in dyestuffs and dyeing industry. 3. Leukemia can occur on long exposure to benzol. 4. Lung cancer is typically found in workers employed in electric cable industries.
Disaster cycle sequence

options.label: A
options.text: Impact; Response; Relief; Rehab; Mitigation; Preparedness

questions.correct_answer: A. Impact; Response; Relief; Rehab; Mitigation; Preparedness

questions.text: Triage which colour indicates highest priority:
Syringe attached with needle should be disposed which coloured bin:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Syringe without needle: Red
  • • Syringe with needle (fixed): White

questions.text: Consider the following statements about correlation between two variables: 1. The correlation is done between an independent variable X and a dependent variable Y. 2. The coefficient of correlation can range from-1to∝. 3. If coefficient of correlation (r) is equal to 1, it indicates there is no association between X and Y. 4. Correlation does not necessarily prove causation.
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Option 2: Correlation coefficient ranges from – 1 to + 1
  • • Option 3: If the correlation coefficient is 1; it means there is perfectly positive relationship.

questions.text: Bilirubin was shown as mg/ dL shown value is in which scale:
Identify the image:
This formula is used to calculate:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • This formula is for SD; SD is referred as root mean square deviation. If sample size if less than 30 then denominator is ‘n-1’ and if more than 30 than ‘n’.

questions.text: Mean +-1 SD corresponds to:
All the following statement are true for central tendency except:

options.label: A
options.text: Arithmetic mean is affected by extreme values.

options.label: B
options.text: Mode is most affected by extreme values.

options.label: C
options.text: Median is calculated by overall observation.

options.label: D
options.text: Mode can be used as qualitative data descriptor.

questions.correct_answer: B. Mode is most affected by extreme values.
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Outliers: Extreme values
  • • • Calculate the median
  • • • Most affected: Mean
  • • • Least affected: Mode
  • • • We apply the Q test

questions.text: All the following maybe used to find the normalcy of data except:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Miscellaneous Statistical Tests:
  • • The Mantel Haenszel test is used for sample sets that are able to be placed in two-by-two tables, but unlike the Fisher Exact test and the chi-squared test, there is no “n” requirement. The test can be used to verify samples with an n as small as two data, or a large n with over 5000 participants. It is used for STRATIFICATION to separate confounder and effect modifier.

questions.text: In Kaplan Meier survival curve, bands used for confidence interval is:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Kaplan-Meier estimator of S(t) together with 95% pointwise confidence intervals and 95% Hall-Wellner confidence bounds. (Most common bands)
  • • The others are Gill and Nair Bands.

questions.text: One child has mental retardation and give him environmental therapy what was considered?
Under the Colombo plan which of the following is true about cancer treatment?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Colombo Plan
  • • • 1950
  • • • Economic development on cooperative basis
  • • • Industrial development
  • • • Agricultural development
  • • • Health promotion
  • • • AIIMS Delhi established under this plan
  • • • with help of New Zealand + Canada
  • • • Cobalt therapy units were installed in medical colleges

questions.text: A researcher is investigating the association between smoking and lung cancer. She recruits 500 participants, including 250 individuals diagnosed with lung cancer and 250 individuals without lung cancer, and collects data on their smoking habits. Which study design is being used in this scenario?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • In a case-control study, participants are selected based on whether they have the outcome of interest (cases) or not (controls). The researcher compares the exposure (smoking habits) between cases (individuals with lung cancer) and controls (individuals without lung cancer) to assess the association between smoking and lung cancer.
